Text.Value: Why die for those who can't defend themselves?
Clan is everything. You don't abandon those you swore to protect.
Hells, we can't just leave. They're kin.

EditorData.NodeContext: This is the start of the dialog but clearly an ongoing argument. You think it's your responsibility, as a tiefling, to stay and help your kin. You're angry, voice is level but will soon grow louder, and utterly convinced that staying at the camp is the right thing to do.

Text.Value: Or would you deny your brother here his chance at fortune in Baldur's Gate?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Looking at Lia but gesturing to Cal.
EditorData.NodeContext: You know the argument is likely going your way and you're being a little bit of a dick here. You know mentioning Lia's brother is a guarantee that she'll give in to your side and leave with you. It's a bit of an underhanded move.

Text.Value: Rolan's right, sis. We should leave - while we still can.

EditorData.NodeContext: You've decided to intervene and try to calm the situation. Your voice is light but gentle. You don't wish to fight with your sister and you definitely don't want to see her hurt but staying.

Text.Value: If we survive, it'll make for a good story I suppose...

EditorData.NodeContext: Kinda sulky but accepting that you'll stay in the grove.

Text.Value: If they cannot fight, they will die. That is as it should be.
Can we all just take a moment? Please?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Looking for one to the other. Stuck in between them, pleading. Hands out as he tries to calm the situation.
EditorData.NodeContext: Your friend and sister are screaming at each other in front of you. Light and easygoing tone as you try to calm the argument.

Text.Value: No. This place is a death trap. Let us leave - immediately!

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has disagreed with you. You're frustrated and angry. You think it's ludicrous that anyone would disagree with you.

Text.Value: Zurgan. Fine. Give it here.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Generic 'taking' animation. Taking coin from the player.
EditorData.NodeContext: 'ZUR-gan.' Frustrated but giving in to the promise of going.

Text.Value: How dare you!
Thank you, Rolan. And thank you, friend.

EditorData.NodeContext: Warm and sincere. Directed at rolan and then player.

Text.Value: You know, that money could go towards a spiffy new outfit for your apprenticeship...?

EditorData.NodeContext: Smile, knowing rolan will give in

Text.Value: Thank you, Rolan.

EditorData.NodeContext: Said sincerely - you've seen Rolan fight and you want him at your side.

Text.Value: Just be responsible for yourself then. We have to stay; it's the right thing to do.
You should all stay. A single blade could make a difference.
Common sense at last. Let's get out of this death trap.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has agreed with you. Said almost as you throw you hands in the air. You think it's ludicrous that anyone WOULDN'T agree with you.

Text.Value: These people aren't fighters. We can help.

EditorData.NodeContext: Ibid.

Text.Value: What? The dangers of overpriced taverns and muddy streets? I think I'll take that risk.
Leave.
Exactly! These types always need saving. We shouldn't sacrifice ourselves for them.
Say nothing.
I made no such oath, and I will not be held responsible for these people.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gritted teeth - frustrated

Text.Value: Thank you! It's the right thing to do, and you know it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gestures towards player at thank you but is looking at Rolan.
EditorData.NodeContext: The player has agreed with you. Thank you is directed at player, the rest at Rolan. You know the argument has likely been won by you - trying to appeal to his morality.

Text.Value: To leave is a heavy choice - it will weigh on whatever path you walk next.
C'mon, sis. We're less of a target alone. We should leave.

EditorData.NodeContext: You've decided to intervene and try to calm the situation. Your voice is light but gentle. You don't wish to fight with your sister and you definitely don't want to see her hurt but staying.

Text.Value: Just like I was saying. I don't want all these lives on my conscience. We need to stay.
Exactly! Hear that, Lia? We're not helping anyone if we're corpses.
The city's not going anywhere. I'm staying - we're needed here.
Zurgan. Fine. I'll stay too. Lest you both end up with your throats slit by a goblin blade.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'ZUR-gan.' You know you've lost and you are NOT being gracious. Rolling your eyes - you love them both but are playing up you staying - like you're doing them a favour.

Text.Value: Have you forgotten Elturel? We should stand by our people - no one else will.
Zurgan. Fine! We'll stay. If we survive, it'll make for a good story I suppose...

EditorData.NodeContext: 'ZUR-gan.'

Text.Value: Only cowards run from a fight.
Get out while you can - the goblins will be back.
But if something happens to these people, it's on us. I hope you know that.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Turning away in a huff. Arms crossed, Angry.
EditorData.NodeContext: Ibid.

Text.Value: Say nothing.
This isn't Elturel and I'm not responsible for every damn tiefling in the world!
Or yell louder. That's fine too.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Sighing as he shrugs. He knows neither is listening to him.
EditorData.NodeContext: Your friend and sister have ignored your plea. You know once they've started they'll just keep arguing until one of them gives in. This is almost said with a shrug and in a light, jokey tone.

Text.Value: Prove him wrong, then. If you think you're able to, that is.
Prove her wrong, then. If you think you're able to, that is.
Prove them wrong, then. If you think you're able to, that is.
I'll not gamble our lives, our futures, on people who are as good as dead. We must leave for Baldur's Gate - at once.

EditorData.NodeContext: You're angry but your voice is level. You think staying at the camp is essentially suicide. You cannot believe it was even suggested. You and your friends have brand new lives waiting for you in Baldur's Gate - to stay at the camp is reckless and pointless to you.

Text.Value: What's the point in blades and spells if we don't bloody use them? We should stay.

EditorData.NodeContext: Your voice is getting louder. You're very angry now. It's your civic duty to use the skills you have to help people. You cannot believe how selfish Rolan is being.

Text.Value: But it is, nevertheless, true. We've risked everything to get this far, we can't afford to throw it all away.
I'd choose the wilderness over the dangers of a city any day. Stay.
That's a low blow.
'Where the weak have need, the strong have a duty'. Stay.
She's right, Rolan. We're better than this.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Almost nudging Rolan with a smile on his face.
EditorData.NodeContext: You've decided to intervene and try to calm the situation. Your voice is light but gentle.

Text.Value: You want fortune? There's coin in it if you stay.
Argh. Fine. Let's sneak away like godsdamned cowards.

EditorData.NodeContext: You know you've lost the argument and this is a last little dig at the end. It's your temper getting the better of you. You're not yelling, but it's said with quiet fury.

Synopsis:
Three people are having an argument. Rolan, Lia and Cal. Lia and Cal are brother and sister, but the three of them have grown up together. They're young, talented tieflings who are heading to Baldur's Gate to start their lives and careers. Rolan argues that they should leave now and get to the city while they still can. Lia argues that it is irresponsible to leave their kin behind. Cal is stuck in the middle.
This is a passionate and fiery argument, both sides are convinced that they are correct.
